sections.content: Du har opholdt dig i Danmark i mindst 5 år

title: You are the parent of an EU/EEA citizen who is a worker in Denmark under EU law

sections.heading: You are the parent of an EU/EEA citizen who is a worker or self-employed person in Denmark under EU law
sections.content: You can apply for equal status with Danish citizens if you are the parent of an EU/EEA citizen or his/her spouse – regardless of the country you are a citizen of If you want to apply for equal status with Danish citizens according to this rule, you must meet these two conditions: Your child must be a worker or self-employed person in Denmark according to EU law. You are supported by your child, who is a worker or self-employed person in Denmark according to EU law, because you have a genuine and effective need of being supported by him/her.

sections.heading: SU is conditional on your child’s status as a worker or self-employed person
sections.content: Please note that if you receive state educational grant (SU) as the parent of an EU/EEA citizen, you must be aware of the fact that your right to SU is a derived right from your child’s status as a worker or self-employed person. This means that you lose the right to SU if your child loses his/her status as a worker or self-employed person in Denmark under EU law.

sections.heading: Worker
sections.content: By “worker or self-employed person” we always mean individuals who can be regarded as workers in Denmark under EU law because they fulfil the rules of EU law regarding effective and genuine work in Denmark. Read more about the term worker or self-employed person under EU law.

sections.heading: Your child is a Danish citizen
sections.content: A Danish citizen, who works in Denmark, is as a rule not a worker or self-employed person under EU law but may have obtained this status by having exercised his/her right to free movement. If your Danish child has obtained a status as a worker or self-employed person in Denmark under EU law, you can also receive SU according to the rules concerning the parent of a worker or self-employed person as described above. Read more about Danish citizens who have obtained status as a worker according to EU law.

sections.heading: Supported by
sections.content:
When you apply for SU, you must be able to prove that for special reasons, you have a genuine and effective need of being supported by your child. It is not sufficient that your child merely undertakes supporting you.
You must attach documentation for this along with the application for equal status for foreign citizens when you apply for SU according to this rule. This means that you must attach documentation for the support in itself, as well as documentation showing that you have a genuine and effective need of being supported by your child.

sections.heading: Parent
sections.content: With the phrasing “parent” we mean a relative in lineal ascent. The rule, therefore, applies to parents as well as grandparents of an EU/EEA citizen, who is a worker or self-employed person in Denmark, or to the worker’s spouse regardless of his/her citizenship.

sections.heading: How to apply
sections.content: Find information about how to apply in minSU for the first time. When we assess whether you can be granted equal status according to EU law, we use the information which is evident from the documentation you attach together with the application for equal status for foreign citizens. It is therefore important that you attach all the documentation you want to be included in our assessment of your application. Documentation that your spouse is a worker, can include your spouse's employment contract and payslips. In addition, we use the information that the national register, the Danish Immigration Service, the State Administration and the Danish Tax Agency (Skattestyrelsen) have registered about you and your spouse. If you think that the information from the national register is inadequate or incorrect, you must contact the national register in the municipality which you live in. If you think that the information which the Danish Immigration Service or the State Administration has registered is incorrect or inadequate, you must contact the Danish Immigration Service. If you think that the information, which Skattestyrelsen has registered, is incorrect or inadequate you must contact Skattestyrelsen.

sections.heading: Ongoing monitoring
sections.content: When you receive SU as a parent of a worker in Denmark under EU law, we will on an ongoing basis monitor that your spouse continues to meet the conditions. The monitoring is, in part, conducted on the basis of the information your spouse's employer reports to the Danish Tax Agency (Skattestyrelsen) about your spouse's income and working hours. If you are not able to prove that you still meet the conditions for receiving SU, we will discontinue your SU and if you have received too much SU, you must pay back this amount. Therefore, if you have received SU for a period where we subsequently find that your spouse could not be regarded as a worker under EU law, you must pay back this SU.

title: You came to Denmark with your parents

sections.heading: You came to Denmark with your parents
sections.content: You can apply for equal status with Danish citizens if you came to Denmark together with your parents If you wish to apply for equal status with Danish citizens on the basis of having moved to Denmark together with your parents, you must have moved to the country before your 20th birthday. It is a condition that the family continues to reside in Denmark and that you and your parents have permanent residence in Denmark.

sections.heading: This is what we do
sections.content: When we investigate whether you and your parents have permanent residence in Denmark, we use the information about you and your parents contained in the national register. If you think that the information in the national register is inadequate or incorrect, you must approach the national register in the municipality you live in.

sections.heading: Equal status can be discontinued
sections.content: If you apply for SU for a new study programme and previously have been granted equal status with Danish citizens according to the Danish rules, you do not have to apply for equal status again. However, please note that you must apply for equal status again if you have lived outside of Denmark for a continuous period of more than two years, as your equal status is no longer valid after this period.

title: You are married to a Danish citizen

sections.heading: You are married to a Danish citizen
sections.content: You can apply for equal status with Danish citizens if you are married to a Danish citizen If you wish to apply for equal status with Danish citizens according to this rule, the fact that you immediately before applying for SU have lived in Denmark for a minimum of two consecutive years and are married to a Danish citizen for at least two years must be registered. You must still be married at the time you apply for SU.

sections.heading: This is what we do
sections.content:
When we investigate whether you have resided continuously in Denmark and whether you are married to a Danish citizen, we use the information contained in the national register about you and your spouse.
We look in the national register to see when you entered Denmark and the information that is registered concerning marriage to a Danish citizen.
If you think that the information in the national register is inadequate or incorrect, you must approach the national register in the municipality you live in.

title: You work or have worked in Denmark

sections.heading: You work or have worked in Denmark
sections.content: You can apply for equal status with Danish citizens if you work or have worked in Denmark for a minimum of 2 years If you wish to be granted equal status with Danish citizens according to this rule, the fact that you have lived in Denmark for a continuous period of at least two years (24 months) and have had at least 30 hours’ paid work a week must be registered. This condition must be fulfilled immediately before you start the study programme for which you have applied for SU.

sections.heading: This is what we do
sections.content: To enable us to process your application for equal status according to this rule, you must attach documentation of having had paid work or been self-employed. You must attach the documentation together with the application for equal status for foreign citizens. Documentation of having paid work is a copy of your employment contract(s) for the whole period. When we investigate whether you fulfil the conditions, we look at what you have been doing during the previous 27 months. This means that if you start you study programme on 1 September 2022, we investigate what you were doing from 1 June 2020 to 31 August 2022. We look at 27 months because of the exception to the effect that you fulfil the requirement concerning 24 months’ employment even if you have had an intervening period of up to 3 months when you did not work (read more about exceptions below). We investigate whether during the 27-month period you: with a valid work permit, have had regular work with standard wages (in the sense of labour law) or have been self-employed as a minimum have worked for two years (24 months) in Denmark have had at least 30 hours’ paid work each week (an average of 30 hours is not sufficient to fulfil the requirement) Certain periods also count as work: You have the right to take twice five weeks’ holiday during the 24 month period in accordance with the Holidays Act. Periods of maximum one year are equated with paid work if in connection with birth or adoption you have looked after your own child in accordance with the rules of the labour market.

sections.heading: Exceptions
sections.content: If your paid work did not cover one continuous period or did not take place immediately before you started your study programme, you can nevertheless be granted equal status with Danish citizens if the intervening period/periods were one of the following: a period of maximum three months in all unemployment, where you were registered at job centre a period of maximum six months when you took a labour market study programme, attended a language school or pursued similar educational activities illness, or national service However, under all circumstances you must have worked for a minimum of two years (24 months) in Denmark. We use the information in the Danish National Register to assess for how long time you have been having residence in Denmark. If you think that the information in the national register is inadequate or incorrect, you must approach the national register in the municipality you live in.

sections.heading: Equal status can be discontinued
sections.content: If you apply for SU for a new study programme and previously have been granted equal status with Danish citizens according to the Danish rules, you do not have to apply for equal status again. However, please note that you must apply for equal status again if you have lived outside of Denmark for a continuous period of more than two years, as your equal status is no longer valid after this period.

sections.heading: Worth noting
sections.content: Paid work placement and other periods of education with pay do not count as paid work. For example, a period of paid work placement as part of an agricultural study programme does not count as paid work.

sections.heading: A stay as an au pair
sections.content: A stay as an au pair is not paid work because as an au pair you have not received a work permit.

title: You belong to the Danish minority in Southern Slesvig

sections.heading: You belong to the Danish minority in Southern Slesvig
sections.content: You can apply for equal status with Danish citizens if you belong to the Danish minority in Southern Slesvig If you wish to apply for equal status with Danish citizens in accordance with this rule, you must be a German citizen but belong to the Danish minority in Southern Slesvig. You must be able to document your affiliation to Denmark, for example by documenting that you have attended one of the Danish schools under the Dansk Skoleforening for Sydslesvig (Danish School Association for Southern Slesvig) , or if you have been a member of Sydslesvigsk Forening (SSF) (Southern Slesvig Association) for a lengthy period of time.

sections.heading: This is what we do
sections.content:
We use the documentation you send to us in assessing whether you can be granted equal status with Danish citizens because you belong to the Danish minority in Southern Slesvig. You must attach the documentation together with the application for equal status for foreign citizens. You can for example document that you belong to the Danish minority in Southern Slesvig by attaching a copy of your diploma from Duborg-Skolen in Flensborg, A.P. Møller Skolen in Slesvig or one of the other schools under the Dansk Skoleforening.
In addition, previously we have granted equal status to applicants who have sent us documentation of membership of Sydslesvigsk Forening for five or more years.

sections.content: If you apply for SU for a new study programme and previously have been granted equal status with Danish citizens according to the Danish rules, you do not have to apply for equal status again. However, please note that you must apply for equal status again if you have lived outside of Denmark for a continuous period of more than two years, as your equal status is no longer valid after this period.

title: You are a Turkish child of a Turkish worker

sections.heading: You are a Turkish child of a Turkish worker
sections.content: You can apply for equal status with Danish citizens if both you and your parent are Turkish citizens, and your parent is or has been a worker in Denmark, and you and your parent have residence in Denmark at the time of the application To apply for equal status according to this rule, both you and your parent must be Turkish citizens. Other than that, and you must fulfill one of these conditions: You are under 21 years of age at the time of application, and your parent is or has been a worker in Denmark. Both you and your parent must have residence in Denmark at the time of the application. It must also be registered that you have lived with your parent in Denmark at some point before applying for equal status, but it is not a requirement that you still live with them. You have turned 21 years of age at the time of application, and you are being supported by your parent who is or has been a worker in Denmark, because you have a genuine and effective need for being supported, despite the fact that you are no longer a child in terms of age. Both you and your parent must have residence in Denmark at the time of the application. It must also be registered that you have lived with your parent in Denmark at some point before applying for equal status, but it is not a requirement that you still live with them.

sections.heading: Worker
sections.content: We assess whether your parent is or has been a worker in the same way as we assess whether a person can be considered a worker in Denmark according to EU law. According to jurisprudence of the Court of Justice of the European Union, the decisive point of whether a person may be considered a worker under EU law is that, for a certain period of time, the person performs services for and under the direction of another person in return for which s/he receives remuneration (salary). At the same time, it is crucial that the employment is genuine and effective and not what EU law refers to as marginal and ancillary. As a general rule, we expect that your parent works a minimum of 10 – 12 hours a week. Since the decisive point according to case law of the Court of Justice of the European Union is that the employment has lasted for a certain period of time, we also expect that your parent, as a starting point, has employment to this extent every week for a continuous period of 10 weeks. In our assessment we also include criteria such as whether your parent is entitled to paid holiday, remuneration during illness, the duration of the employment relationship and whether a collective agreement applies to the employment. Furthermore, in our assessment we also put emphasis on whether your parent has a gross income of a certain size every month. The general price and wage development in Denmark means that wages are continuously increasing. We take this into account when assessing whether your parent may be considered a worker under EU law.

sections.heading: Worker
sections.content: By "child of," we mean a Turkish citizen who is the child of a Turkish citizen or the child of the Turkish worker's spouse or registered partner.

sections.heading: If you have turned 21 years of age (condition no. 2)
sections.content: If you have turned 21 years of age when you apply for SU, you must be able to prove that for special reasons, you have a genuine and effective need of being supported by your parent regardless of the fact that you are an adult. It is not sufficient that your parent merely undertake supporting you. You must attach documentation for this along with the application for equal status for foreign citizens when you apply for SU according to one of those rules. The documentation must show that your parent is supporting you. If you are over 21 years of age, you must also attach information and documentation for your situation which shows that you have a genuine and effective need for being supported by your parent despite the fact that you are a grown-up.

sections.heading: How to apply
sections.content: Find information about how to apply for SU and equal status in minSU for the first time here. Under point 9 (Consent and liability) of the application for foreign citizens applying for equal status with Danish citizens, you must state that you are applying for equal status because you are a Turkish child of a Turkish worker. You must also attach documentation to prove that you meet this requirement. When assessing whether you can be granted equal status based on this condition, we always make a specific assessment of all the information in your case. We will look, among other things, at the documentation you attach to your application for equal status with Danish citizens. Therefore, it is important that you attach all the documentation you want to be included in our assessment of your application. Documentation may include an employment contract and pay slips from your parent's employer in Denmark. We also use information from the national register of persons and the tax authorities. In addition, we use information from the national register and the Danish Tax Agency (Skattestyrelsen). If you think that the information from the national register is inadequate or incorrect, you must contact the national register in the municipality which you live in. If you think that the information, which Skattestyrelsen has registered, is incorrect or inadequate you must contact Skattestyrelsen.

sections.heading: Equal status can be discontinued
sections.content: If you apply for SU for a new study programme and previously have been granted equal status with Danish citizens according to the Danish rules, you do not have to apply for equal status again. However, please note that you must apply for equal status again if you have lived outside of Denmark for a continuous period of more than two years, as your equal status is no longer valid after this period.

sections.content: If you have been granted equal status according to Danish rules, you cannot receive SU for a whole study programme abroad

sections.heading: Scenarier og eksempler: Hvad betyder reformen for mig?
sections.content:
Læs scenarier og eksempler på, hvordan de nye SU-regler kan påvirke din SU for januar 2027 og frem, hvis du begynder på en ny videregående eller privat uddannelse den 1. juli 2025 eller senere.

Det er dit uddannelsessted, som skal vejlede dig om de nye SU-regler og om dine SU-forhold og om, hvordan du kan planlægge dit uddannelsesforløb og din SU i forhold til reformen.

sections.heading: Scenarier - de nye SU-regler
sections.content: Se scenarier på, hvad de nye regler for SU til videregående uddannelse kommer til at betyde for dig

sections.heading: Scenarie 1: Du begynder på en bacheloruddannelse umiddelbart efter at have færdiggjort din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse
sections.content: Du færdiggør i sommeren 2025 din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse og begynder umiddelbart efter på din bacheloruddannelse. Fordi du begynder på din videregående uddannelse i september 2025, er du fra januar 2027 omfattet af de nye regler. Din samlede ramme bliver derfor fra januar 2027 og frem nedskrevet fra 70 til 58 SU-klip, og din udvidede støttetid på 12 SU-klip bortfalder.

sections.heading: Scenarie 2: Du begynder på en professionsbachelor umiddelbart efter at have færdiggjort din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse
sections.content: Du færdiggør i sommeren 2025 din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse og begynder umiddelbart efter på din professionsbachelor. Fordi du starter på din videregående uddannelse i september 2025, er du fra januar 2027 omfattet af de nye regler. Din samlede ramme bliver derfor fra januar 2027 og frem nedskrevet fra 70 til 58 SU-klip, og din udvidede støttetid på 12 SU-klip bortfalder. Du kommer ikke til at mangle klip, når du begynder på din kandidatuddannelse, selvom din professionsbachelor- og kandidatuddannelse tilsammen har en normeret studietid, der overstiger 58 SU-klip. Læs mere om reglerne for udvidelse af den overordnede ramme i denne særlige situation her.

sections.heading: Scenarie 3: Du begynder på en kandidatuddannelse efter at have brugt 4 års SU til to tidligere bacheloruddannelser
sections.content: Du har tidligere fået SU i 12 måneder til en bacheloruddannelse, som du afbrød. Du skiftede til en anden bacheloruddannelse, som du færdiggjorde på normeret tid, hvilket vil sige 34 måneder, svarende til 34 SU-klip. Før du begynder på din kandidatuddannelse i september 2025, har du derfor allerede brugt 46 SU-klip (12+34). Fordi du begynder på din kandidatuddannelse i september 2025, er du fra januar 2027 omfattet af de nye regler. Din samlede ramme bliver derfor fra januar 2027 og frem nedskrevet fra 70 til 58 SU-klip og din udvidede støttetid på 12 SU-klip bortfalder. Du kommer derfor til at mangle SU-klip de sidste 6 måneder af din kandidatuddannelse, men du har mulighed for at optage slutlån.

sections.heading: Eksempler – de nye SU-regler
sections.content: Nedenfor kan du læse en række eksempler på, hvordan de nye SU-regler kan påvirke din SU i forskellige situationer. Eksemplerne er kun eksempler, og der kan derfor være forhold omkring din nuværende og eventuelt tidligere videregående uddannelser og din SU, som kan påvirke din SU på en anden måde end i eksemplerne, selv om din situation måske ligger tæt op ad eksemplerne:

sections.heading: Eksempel 1: Du går på bacheloruddannelsen i medicin og har brugt SU-klip på en tidligere uddannelse
sections.content: Du har tidligere brugt 24 SU-klip på læreruddannelsen. Du begynder på bacheloruddannelsen i medicin den 1. september 2024. Da du er begyndt på bacheloruddannelsen i medicin før den 1. juli 2025, gælder de nye SU-regler ikke for den SU, som du modtager til bacheloruddannelsen i medicin. Når du er færdig med din bacheloruddannelse i medicin på normeret studietid i juni 2027, har du i alt brugt 34 SU-klip på din bacheloruddannelse. Du har på dette tidspunkt i alt brugt 58 SU-klip på videregående uddannelse (24 SU-klip på læreruddannelsen og 34 SU-klip på bacheloruddannelse i medicin). Du bliver indskrevet på kandidatuddannelsen i medicin i juli 2027. Da du er begyndt på kandidatuddannelsen i medicin den 1. juli 2025 eller senere, gælder de nye SU-regler for den SU, som du modtager til kandidatuddannelsen i medicin. Efter de nye SU-regler nedskrives din ramme fra 70 til 58 SU-klip. Da du har brugt i alt 58 SU-klip på videregående uddannelser, har du som udgangspunkt ikke flere SU-klip i din ramme. Men fordi kandidatuddannelsen i medicin er normeret til 3 år (modsat normalt 2 år for øvrige kandidatuddannelser), udvides din ramme med 12 SU-klip. Læs mere om udvidelse af rammen Du har derfor i alt 12 SU-klip tilbage, som du kan bruge på kandidatuddannelsen i medicin. Når du har brugt de 12 SU-klip, har du mulighed for at optage slutlån i de sidste 2 år af kandidatuddannelsen i medicin. Se i øvrigt også eksempel 10 "Dit samlede uddannelsesforløbs normerede studietid overstiger 58 måneder, og du har brugt SU-klip på en tidligere uddannelse" om rammeudvidelse.

sections.heading: Eksempel 2: Du dumper eksamen og bliver forsinket på din bacheloruddannelse – og bruger SU udover uddannelsens normerede tid
sections.content: Du færdiggør i sommeren 2024 din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse og begynder den 1. september 2024 på en bacheloruddannelse. Efter de nuværende regler udvides din støttetid med 12 SU-klip, fordi du begynder på din første videregående uddannelse senest 2 år efter at have afsluttet din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse. Da du er begyndt på bacheloruddannelsen før den 1. juli 2025, gælder de nye SU-regler ikke for den SU, du modtager til bacheloruddannelsen. Du dumper to eksamener og bliver et semester forsinket på din bacheloruddannelse. Du vælger at modtage SU gennem hele din bacheloruddannelse. Du har SU til dette, fordi din støttetid er blevet udvidet med 12 SU-klip som beskrevet først i eksemplet. Når du er færdig med din bacheloruddannelse i januar 2028, har du i alt brugt 41 SU-klip på din bacheloruddannelse. Du har dermed brugt 7 SU-klip mere, end uddannelsen er normeret til. Du begynder som vinterstarter på en kandidatuddannelse i februar 2028. Uddannelsen er normeret til 24 SU-klip. Da du er begyndt på kandidatuddannelsen efter den 1. juli 2025, gælder de nye SU-regler for den SU, som du modtager til kandidatuddannelsen. Efter de nye SU-regler nedskrives din ramme fra 70 til 58 SU-klip. Da du har brugt i alt 41 SU-klip på videregående uddannelser, har du 17 SU-klip tilbage i din ramme (58 SU-klip – 41 SU-klip = 17 SU-klip). Da din kandidatuddannelse er normeret til 24 SU-klip, kommer du derfor til at mangle 7 SU-klip til din kandidatuddannelse. Når du har brugt dine SU-klip, har du mulighed for at optage slutlån i de sidste 7 måneder af kandidatuddannelsen.

sections.heading: Eksempel 3: Du udskyder en eksamen og forlænger din uddannelse - og bruger SU-klip ud over uddannelsens normerede tid
sections.content: Du færdiggjorde i sommeren 2024 din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse og begyndte den 1. september 2024 på en bacheloruddannelse, der er normeret til 3 år (34 SU-klip). Efter de nuværende regler udvides din støttetid med 12 SU-klip, fordi du er begyndt på din første videregående uddannelse senest 2 år efter at have afsluttet din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse. Da du er begyndt på bacheloruddannelsen før den 1. juli 2025, gælder de nye SU-regler ikke for den SU, du modtager til bacheloruddannelsen. Du vælger at udskyde et par eksamener på din bacheloruddannelse til et senere semester, og du forlænger dermed din bacheloruddannelse med et semester. Du vælger at modtage SU gennem hele din bacheloruddannelse. Du har SU til dette, fordi din støttetid er blevet udvidet med 12 SU-klip som beskrevet først i eksemplet. Når du er færdig med din bacheloruddannelse i januar 2028, har du i alt brugt 41 SU-klip på din bacheloruddannelse, svarende til 3,5 år. Du har dermed brugt 7 SU-klip mere end uddannelsen er normeret til. Du begynder som vinterstarter på en kandidatuddannelse i februar 2028. Uddannelsen er normeret til 2 år (24 SU-klip). Da du er begyndt på kandidatuddannelsen efter den 1. juli 2025, gælder de nye SU-regler for den SU, som du modtager til kandidatuddannelsen. Efter de nye SU-regler nedskrives din ramme fra 70 til 58 SU-klip. Da du har brugt i alt 41 SU-klip på videregående uddannelser, har du 17 SU-klip tilbage i din ramme (58 SU-klip – 41 SU-klip = 17 SU-klip). Da din kandidatuddannelse er normeret til 24 SU-klip, kommer du derfor til at mangle 7 SU-klip til din kandidatuddannelse. Når du har brugt dine SU-klip, har du mulighed for at optage slutlån i de sidste 7 måneder af kandidatuddannelsen.

sections.heading: Eksempel 4: Du har modtaget fødsels-støtte i 9 måneder og bruger SU-klip, indtil du skal begynde på næste semester
sections.content: Du færdiggjorde i sommeren 2024 din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse og begynder den 1. september 2024 på en bacheloruddannelse, der er normeret til 3 år (34 SU-klip). Efter de nuværende regler udvides din støttetid med 12 SU-klip, fordi du er begyndt på din første videregående uddannelse senest 2 år efter at have afsluttet din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse. Da du er begyndt på bacheloruddannelsen før den 1. juli 2025, gælder de nye SU-regler ikke for den SU, du modtager til bacheloruddannelsen. Under din bacheloruddannelse bliver du forælder, og du vælger at modtage fødsels-støtte i de i alt 9 måneder, du har ret til fødsels-støtte. Efter perioden med fødsels-støtte går der 3 måneder, før du kan begynde på et nyt semester, og du vælger at modtage SU i disse 3 måneder. Du har SU til dette, fordi din støttetid er blevet udvidet med 12 SU-klip som beskrevet først i eksemplet. Når du er færdig med din bacheloruddannelse i juni 2028, har du i alt brugt 37 SU-klip på din bacheloruddannelse. Du har dermed brugt 3 SU-klip mere, end uddannelsen er normeret til. Du begynder på en kandidatuddannelse i september 2028. Uddannelsen er normeret til 2 år (24 SU-klip). Da du er begyndt på kandidatuddannelsen efter den 1. juli 2025, gælder de nye SU-regler for den SU, som du modtager til kandidatuddannelsen. Efter de nye SU-regler nedskrives din ramme fra 70 til 58 SU-klip. Da du har brugt i alt 37 SU-klip på videregående uddannelser, har du 21 SU-klip tilbage i din ramme (58 SU-klip – 37 SU-klip = 21 SU-klip). Da din kandidatuddannelse er normeret til 24 SU-klip, kommer du derfor til at mangle 3 SU-klip til din kandidatuddannelse. Når du har brugt dine SU-klip, har du mulighed for at optage slutlån i den sidste måned af kandidatuddannelsen.

sections.heading: Eksempel 5: Du har brugt SU-klip på en tidligere videregående uddannelse og går nu på en bacheloruddannelse – og begynder på en kandidatuddannelse i 2027
sections.content: Du har tidligere brugt 24 SU-klip på læreruddannelsen, som du afbrød. Du begyndte på en bacheloruddannelse (for eksempel i humaniora) den 1. september 2024. Da du er begyndt på bacheloruddannelsen før den 1. juli 2025, gælder de nye SU-regler ikke for den SU, som du modtager til bacheloruddannelsen. Når du er færdig med din bacheloruddannelse på normeret studietid i juni 2027, har du i alt brugt 34 SU-klip på din bacheloruddannelse. Du har på dette tidspunkt i alt brugt 58 SU-klip til videregående uddannelser (24 SU-klip på læreruddannelsen og 34 SU-klip på bacheloruddannelse). Du begynder på en kandidatuddannelse i september 2027. Da du er begyndt på kandidatuddannelsen den 1. juli 2025 eller senere, gælder de nye SU-regler for den SU, som du modtager til kandidatuddannelsen. Efter de nye SU-regler nedskrives din ramme fra 70 til 58 SU-klip. Da du tidligere har brugt i alt 58 SU-klip på videregående uddannelser, har du som udgangspunkt ikke flere SU-klip i din ramme. Du har derfor ikke SU-klip til din kandidatuddannelse. Du har mulighed for at optage slutlån på kandidatuddannelsen.

sections.heading: Eksempel 6: Du er før januar 2027 blevet 12 måneder forsinket i din uddannelse på grund af sygdom og er blevet tildelt tillæg af SU-klip
sections.content: Du begynder på en bacheloruddannelse den 1. september 2021, der er normeret til 34 SU-klip. Du bliver i juni 2025 færdig med din bachelor efter et års forsinkelse på grund af sygdom, og har derfor brugt i alt 46 SU-klip. Inden du færdiggjorde din bacheloruddannelse, søgte du tillæg af SU-klip for den forsinkelse i din uddannelse, som din sygdomsperiode medførte, og du blev tildelt 12 tillæg af SU-klip. Du har derfor nu en samlet ramme på 82 SU-klip (70+12), som du kan bruge til videregående uddannelser. Du begynder den 1. juli 2025 på en kandidatuddannelse, der er normeret til 24 SU-klip. Da du er begyndt på kandidatuddannelsen den 1. juli 2025 eller senere, vil de nye SU-regler gælde for din SU fra og med januar 2027. Du bruger i perioden fra juli 2025 til og med december 2026 18 SU-klip og har i december 2026 i alt brugt 64 SU-klip (46 + 18 SU-klip). Efter de nye SU-regler nedskrives din ramme i januar 2027 med 12 SU-klip, så du nu har en samlet ramme på 70 SU-klip (82-12). Fordi du tidligere har brugt 64 SU-klip, har du nu 6 SU-klip tilbage, som du kan bruge til resten af din kandidatuddannelse. I forhold til de tillæg af SU-klip, du tidligere er tildelt (i alt 12 tillæg af SU-klip), så er disse SU-klip lagt til din overordnede ramme på 70 SU-klip som en kompensation for de SU-klip, du modtog i den periode, hvor du blev forsinket i din uddannelse. Dine tillæg af SU-klip vil fortsat være lagt til din overordnede ramme, selv om den nedskrives med 12 SU-klip, og som du kan se i eksemplet, indgår de i dit samlede antal SU-klip til rest.

sections.heading: Eksempel 7: Du er før januar 2027 blevet 6 måneder forsinket i din uddannelse på grund sygdom og er blevet tildelt tillæg af SU-klip
sections.content: Du begynder på en bacheloruddannelse den 1. september 2021, der er normeret til 34 SU-klip. Du bliver i vinteren 2025 færdig med din bacheloruddannelse efter et halvt års forsinkelse på grund af sygdom, og har derfor brugt i alt 40 SU-klip. Inden du færdiggjorde din bacheloruddannelse, søgte du tillæg af SU-klip for den forsinkelse i din uddannelse, som din sygdomsperiode medførte, og du blev tildelt 6 tillæg af SU-klip. Du har derfor nu en samlet ramme på 76 SU-klip (70+6), som du kan bruge til videregående uddannelser. Du begynder den 1. juli 2025 på en kandidatuddannelse, der er normeret til 24 SU-klip. Da du er begyndt på kandidatuddannelsen den 1. juli 2025 eller senere, vil de nye SU-regler gælde for din SU fra og med januar 2027. Du bruger i perioden fra juli 2025 til og med december 2026 18 SU-klip og har i december 2026 i alt brugt 58 SU-klip (40 + 18 SU-klip). Efter de nye SU-regler nedskrives din ramme i januar 2027 med 12 SU-klip, så du nu har en samlet ramme på 64 SU-klip (76-12). Fordi du tidligere har brugt 58 SU-klip, har du nu 6 SU-klip tilbage, som du kan bruge til resten af din kandidatuddannelse. I forhold til de tillæg af SU-klip, du tidligere er tildelt (i alt 6 tillæg af SU-klip), så er disse SU-klip lagt til din overordnede ramme på 70 SU-klip som en kompensation for de SU-klip, du modtog i den periode, hvor du blev forsinket i din uddannelse. Dine tillæg af SU-klip vil fortsat være lagt til din overordnede ramme, selv om den nedskrives med 12 SU-klip, og som du kan se i eksemplet, indgår de i dit samlede antal SU-klip til rest.

sections.heading: Eksempel 8: Du er efter januar 2027 blevet 12 måneder forsinket i din uddannelse på grund sygdom og er blevet tildelt tillæg af SU-klip
sections.content: Du begynder på en bacheloruddannelse den 1. september 2024. Da du er begyndt på bacheloruddannelsen før den 1. juli 2025, gælder de nye SU-regler ikke for den SU, som du modtager til bacheloruddannelsen. Når du er færdig med din bacheloruddannelse uden forsinkelse i juni 2027, har du i alt brugt 34 SU-klip på din bacheloruddannelse. Din efterfølgende kandidatuddannelse varer 22 måneder, men er normeret til 24 SU-klip, fordi du modtager SU-klip i sommerferien (juli og august 2027). Da du begynder på kandidatuddannelsen i 2027, gælder de nye SU-regler for den SU, som du modtager til kandidatuddannelsen. Efter de nye SU-regler nedskrives din ramme med 12 SU-klip, så du nu har en samlet ramme på 58 SU-klip (70-12). Fordi du tidligere har brugt 34 SU-klip, har du nu 24 SU-klip tilbage i rammen, som du kan bruge til din kandidatuddannelse. Du bliver efter dit 2. semester på kandidatuddannelsen et halvt år forsinket på grund af sygdom og skal derfor bruge 30 SU-klip i stedet for 24 SU-klip til at færdiggøre din kandidatuddannelse. Efter din sygdomsperiode søger du om tillæg af SU-klip for din forsinkelse, og du bliver tildelt 6 tillæg af SU-klip. Du har derfor nu en samlet ramme på 64 (58+6) og har SU til resten af din kandidatuddannelse.

sections.heading: Eksempel 9: Genoptagelse af en tidligere påbegyndt videregående uddannelse
sections.content: Du begynder på sygeplejerskeuddannelsen den 1. september 2023. Uddannelsen er normeret til at vare 3,5 år, svarende til 41 SU-klip. Du vælger efter 4 semestre (2 år) at afbryde din uddannelse og har brugt 24 SU-klip. Efter 2 års pause genoptager du den 1. september 2027 sygeplejerskeuddannelsen og starter på 5. semester. Dit uddannelsessted har vurderet, at den uddannelse, du begynder på i 2027 er den samme, som du tidligere gik på, og at du dermed genoptager din uddannelse. Normalt vil studerende med uddannelsesstart den 1. juli 2025 eller senere være omfattet af de nye SU-regler fra januar 2027 og frem, men fordi du genoptager en uddannelse, som du oprindeligt begyndte på den 1. september 2023 - altså før 1. juli 2025 - er du ikke omfattet af de nye regler. Det betyder, at du ved din genoptagelse den 1. september 2027 fortsat har en overordnet ramme på 70 SU-klip til videregående uddannelser. Dit tidligere forbrug af SU-klip til uddannelsen bliver videreført, så når du starter på 5. semester, har du et forbrug på 24 SU-klip på uddannelsen. Begynder du senere på en ny videregående uddannelse (eksempelvis en kandidatuddannelse i sygepleje), vil du være omfattet af de nye regler, og din ramme vil på det tidspunkt blive nedskrevet med 12 SU-klip fra 70 til 58 SU-klip.

sections.heading: Eksempel 10: Dit samlede uddannelsesforløbs normerede studietid overstiger 58 måneder, og du har brugt SU-klip på en tidligere uddannelse
sections.content: Du har tidligere brugt 10 SU-klip på en videregående uddannelse, som du afbrød. Du begynder på sygeplejerskeuddannelsen den 1. september 2024. Da du er begyndt på sygeplejerskeuddannelsen før den 1. juli 2025, gælder de nye SU-regler ikke for den SU, som du modtager til denne uddannelse. Når du er færdig med din professionsbacheloruddannelse som sygeplejerske på normeret studietid i januar 2028, har du i alt brugt 41 SU-klip på din sygeplejerskeuddannelse svarende til 3,5 år. Du har på dette tidspunkt i alt brugt 51 SU-klip på videregående uddannelser (10 SU-klip på en tidligere uddannelse og 41 SU-klip på sygeplejerskeuddannelsen). Du bliver indskrevet på kandidatuddannelsen i sygepleje i september 2028. Uddannelsen er normeret til 22 SU-klip svarende til 2 år. Da du er begyndt på kandidatuddannelsen i sygepleje den 1. juli 2025 eller senere, gælder de nye SU-regler for den SU, som du modtager til kandidatuddannelsen i sygepleje. Efter de nye SU-regler nedskrives din ramme fra 70 til 58 SU-klip, når du begynder på kandidatuddannelsen i sygepleje. Da du har brugt i alt 51 SU-klip på videregående uddannelser, har du som udgangspunkt kun 7 SU-klip tilbage. Men fordi dit samlede uddannelsesforløbs normering er over 58 måneder, kan din samlede ramme udvides med det antal SU-klip, der svarer til antallet af måneder, som uddannelsesforløbets samlede normering overstiger 58 måneder. Dit uddannelsesforløbs samlede normering er 63 måneder (41 måneder på sygeplejerskeuddannelsen og 22 måneder på kandidatuddannelsen i sygepleje). Det vil sige, at din samlede ramme kan udvides med 5 SU-klip. Læs mere om udvidelse af rammen her. Du har derfor i alt 12 SU-klip tilbage (7+5), som du kan bruge på kandidatuddannelsen i sygepleje. Når du har brugt de 12 SU-klip, har du mulighed for at optage slutlån i det sidste år af kandidatuddannelsen i sygepleje. Se i øvrigt også eksempel 1 "Du går på bacheloruddannelsen i medicin og har brugt SU-klip på en tidligere uddannelse" om rammeudvidelse.

sections.heading: Eksempel 11: Du har brugt mere end 58 SU-klip og bliver efter januar 2027 tildelt tillæg af SU-klip for en forsinkelse, der skete før januar 2027
sections.content: Du færdiggør i sommeren 2020 din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse og begynder den 1. september 2020 på en bacheloruddannelse. Du afbryder bacheloruddannelsen efter 12 måneder med et forbrug på 12 SU-klip. Du begynder på bacheloruddannelsen i filosofi den 1. september 2022, der er normeret til 34 SU-klip. Efter de nuværende regler udvides din støttetid med 12 SU-klip, fordi du begyndte på din første videregående uddannelse senest 2 år efter at have afsluttet din adgangsgivende ungdomsuddannelse. Du bliver i juni 2026 færdig med din bacheloruddannelse efter et års forsinkelse på grund af sygdom, og har derfor brugt i alt 58 (12+34+12) SU-klip i din overordnede ramme. Du bliver i juli 2026 indskrevet på kandidatuddannelsen i filosofi, der er normeret til 24 SU-klip. Da du begynder på kandidatuddannelsen den 1. juli 2025 eller senere, vil de nye SU-regler gælde for din SU fra og med januar 2027. Du bruger i perioden fra juli 2026 til og med december 2026 6 SU-klip og har i december 2026 i alt brugt 64 SU-klip (58+6) i din overordnede ramme. Efter de nye SU-regler nedskrives din overordnede ramme i januar 2027 fra 70 til 58 SU-klip. Fordi du har brugt mere end 58 SU-klip, har du derfor ikke flere SU-klip til videregående uddannelser. Fra Alma starter med at få SU-klip til sin kandidatuddannelse 1. juli 2025, regner hun med at bruge 18 SU-klip til og med december 2026. Når de nye regler træder i kraft fra januar 2027, har Alma altså brug for 6 SU-klip til at færdiggøre sin uddannelse.

sections.heading: Udregning
sections.content: Alma har nu regnet ud, at hun har 6 SU-klip tilbage 1. januar 2027, når de nye regler træder i kraft. Hvis Almas plan holder, har hun altså nok SU-klip til at færdiggøre sin uddannelse, da hun fra januar 2027 har brug for 6 SU-klip (og har 6 SU-klip til rådighed).

sections.heading: Regnevejledning
sections.content: For at beregne, hvor mange SU-klip, du har, når de nye regler træder i kraft til januar 2027, skal du bruge oplysninger fra dit SU-klippekort, som du finder i minSU. Derudover skal du finde ud af, hvor mange SU-klip du forventer at bruge fremover.

sections.heading: 1. Log ind i minSU
sections.content: log ind i minSU klik på 'Se din SU' klik på 'Klippekort' find boksen 'Ramme'

sections.heading: 2. Find oplysninger i dit klippekort
sections.content: I boksen 'Ramme' skal du bruge de aktuelle oplysninger om: din overordnede ramme til videregående uddannelser i alt - men du skal altid gå ud fra 58 SU-klip (også selv om der står 70 i minSU), da denne beregning tager udgangspunkt i de nye regler tillæg af SU-klip på grund af rådsarbejde, sygdom eller andre andre særlige forhold udvidelse af rammen på grund af uddannelsesforløb over 58 måneder dit forbrug af SU-klip i alt

sections.heading: 3. Vurder, hvor mange måneder, du forventer at bruge SU fremover
sections.content: Du skal finde ud af, hvordan din uddannelse (både nuværende og fremtidige) er tilrettelagt, og hvor mange måneder du forventer at få udbetalt SU-klip fremover - det vil sige ud over det forbrug, der fremgår af minSU. Du skal finde ud af: hvor mange måneder din uddannelse varer (uddannelsens normering) om der er måneder, hvor du ikke forventer at få udbetalt SU-klip - for eksempel hvis du skal i lønnet praktik, holder orlov eller af andre grunde ikke kan få SU Tal eventuelt med din SU-medarbejder på dit uddannelsessted om, hvordan dit uddannelsesforløb er tilrettelagt. title: Examples of cases – worker under EU law

sections.heading: Examples of cases – worker under EU law
sections.content: Please read examples of applications from foreign students who have applied for SU on the basis of their status as a worker under EU law If you are a worker or a self-employed person under EU law, you may receive SU on equal terms with Danish citizens. Below you will find a number of examples of cases involving foreign students who are EU/EEA citizens and have applied for SU on the basis of their status as a worker under EU law. The examples show our decisions which in all cases are made on the basis of an individual assessment in relation to every student’s entire case. Therefore there may be aspects regarding you application that will lead to another decision even if your circumstances may be very close to the examples:

sections.heading: Example 1 – started working at study start
sections.content: An Italian citizen travels to Denmark in July 2024. On 26 August 2024, he gets a job working 10 hours a week earning 120 kr. an hour and being entitled to vacation according to the Danish Holiday Act. In September 2024, he starts studying and applies for SU. We approve that he can receive SU as worker under EU law from September. He can then receive SU as long as he studies and, at the same time, works a minimum of 10–12 hours a week.

sections.heading: Example 2 – stopped working during studies
sections.content: A German citizen travels to Denmark in April 2024 and immediately gets a job 12 hours a week. When he starts studying in August 2024, he is granted SU as a worker under EU law. In September, he stops working but does not inform us until December 2024. We therefore discontinue his SU and require him to pay back his SU for the months of September to December as he could not be considered a worker in Denmark according to EU law during this period.

sections.heading: Example 3 – started working after study start
sections.content: A Spanish citizen travels to Denmark in January 2024. In February 2024, she starts studying but has no paid work and therefore does not qualify for SU as a worker under EU law. On 2 April 2024 she starts working 12 hours a week and therefore applies for SU from the same month. We approve that she can receive SU as worker under EU law from April. She is entitled to SU as long as she studies and works a minimum of 10–12 hours a week.

sections.heading: Example 4 – reduction in number of working hours during studies
sections.content: A Swedish citizen travels to Denmark in March 2024. In the first 6 months she works approximately 30 hours a week. In September 2024 she is admitted to a study programme and applies for SU. At study start she reduces her working hours to 8 hours a week. It is stated in her employment contract that she is not entitled to pay during holiday or remuneration during illness and that a collective agreement does not apply to the employment. After a concrete assessment of all the specific circumstances of her case, her application for SU is rejected because we find that she is not considered a worker under EU law while she studies.

sections.heading: Example 5 - termination with immediate registration as a job seeker
sections.content: A Norwegian citizen receives SU as a worker under EU law while studying in Denmark because she works 13 hours per week. On February 1, 2024, she is terminated with one month’s notice due to lack of assignments and registers the same day as a job seeker on www.jobnet.dk with the intention of finding new employment, which she immediately informs us about. We assess that she became involuntarily unemployed and registered as a job seeker immediately after her termination with the intention of finding new employment. On an ongoing basis we will assess whether she can continue to be considered a worker under EU law.

sections.heading: Example 6 - termination with late registration as a job seeker
sections.content: A Hungarian citizen is studying in Denmark and receives SU as a worker under EU law because he works 12 hours per week. On May 24, 2024, he is terminated with one month’s notice without informing us. During our monitoring of his status as a worker in November 2024, we discover that he has not had a job from July to October 2024. He registered as a job seeker on July 19, 2024, on www.jobnet.dk. From November 1, 2024, he begins a new job working 15 hours per week. His SU from July through October 2024 must therefore be repaid, as we assess that he cannot maintain his status as a worker in Denmark under EU law due to involuntary unemployment. We emphasize that he did not immediately register as a job seeker after his termination. He continues to receive SU from November 1, 2024, when he once again fulfills the conditions to be considered a worker in Denmark under EU law.

sections.heading: Example 7 - temporary unable to work due to illness or accident
sections.content: A Romanian citizen travels to Denmark in September 2023 and begins working 11 hours per week as a waiter. When he starts studying in November 2023, he is granted SU as a worker in Denmark under EU law. In April 2024, he fractures his ankle. He immediately submits medical documentation confirming that he is temporarily unable to work due to illness for six weeks, as he is not allowed to put weight on his foot or walk long distances, which are essential for performing his job as a waiter. We approve that he maintains the status as worker during the period. After the six weeks, he resumes his job, working 11 hours per week, and is therefore still eligible to receive SU.

sections.heading: Example 8 – internship during studies
sections.content: A Polish citizen receives SU for her education as she works 15 hours per week and is considered a worker under EU law. In January 2024, she informs us that she will undertake a six-month unpaid internship in the United States, taking a leave of absence from her job from February to July 2024. She cannot receive SU during her internship period because she is no longer a worker in Denmark. Upon returning from the United States and resuming her job alongside her studies, she can receive SU again after reapplying for SU and equal status with Danish citizens.

sections.heading: Example 9 – self-employed person
sections.content: A French citizen has started a business in 2024 in Denmark and now applies for SU. She submits documentation showing that there are economic activities in her business in the form of invoices and financial statements for the current year. Furthermore, she submits a copy of all contracts she has made with business partners, a business plan, an expected monthly budget, showing her income and expenses for the next 12 months. It appears from the documentation that she expects an annual turnover of 72.000 DKK, corresponding to 6.000 DKK per month. We conduct a specific assessment of the submitted documentation. We assess that she runs the business on a fairly regular basis in a serious matter and with the purpose of achieving economic profit. We also assess that the extent of the business’ economic activities is of such a size that she can be considered a self-employed person. Therefore, we assess that she has proven to have established herself as a self-employed person in Denmark under EU law. She is thus entitled to receive SU as long as she continues to run her business to the same extent along with her studies.

sections.heading: Continuity and retraining
sections.content: Read more about how you can apply for SU if you fulfil the rule of having previously been a worker or self-employed person in Denmark

sections.heading: Continuity
sections.content: In certain instances, you can retain your status as an EU worker despite no longer being in employment. This applies if you wish to educate yourself in the occupational field within which you have worked in Denmark. In this regard, there must be continuity (a connection in terms of content and time) between your earlier job and the education programme for which you are seeking SU. The relevant work must be finished before starting the education programme for which you have applied for SU.

sections.heading: Retraining
sections.content: You can also retain your status as a worker if you have become involuntarily unemployed due to health reasons or structural conditions on the labour market, as a result of which you are prevented from performing the job for which you are trained and therefore need to undergo retraining. In this regard, it is a requirement that the education programme for which you are seeking SU aims to prepare you for employment in a field unrelated in terms of content and time to your previous work in Denmark. If you are unskilled, you will be ineligible for SU under this rule.

sections.heading: How we handle cases
sections.content: When assessing whether you fulfil one of the criteria, we look at the documentation that you have attached together with the application for equal status for foreign citizens. You can access the application for equal status by clicking on the receipt page you get when you have applied for SU in minSU. If you are granted SU, we do not require you to work alongside your studies in Denmark.

sections.content: Read examples of cases where foreign students have applied for SU on the basis of their previous status as a worker under EU law.

title: Examples of cases – continuity and retaining

sections.heading: Examples of cases – continuity and retaining
sections.content: Read examples of applications from foreign students who have applied for SU on the basis of their previous status as a worker under EU law In very few instances, you can retain your status as a worker under EU law despite no longer being in employment. This applies if you wish to educate yourself in the occupational field within which you are already working in Denmark, or if you have become ill and can no longer perform the job for which you are trained and therefore need to undergo retraining. Below, you can read a number of examples of cases involving foreign students who are EU/EEA citizens and have applied for SU on the basis of the rules of EU law governing retention of previous worker status. The examples show our decisions, which have all been made on the basis of judgements in relation to each student’s entire case. Therefore there may be factors regarding your application that lead to a different decision, even though your situation might closely resemble the examples.

sections.heading: Example 1: SU application approved on the basis of connection in terms of time and content between job and new education programme
sections.content: In very few instances, you can retain your status as a worker under EU law despite no longer being in employment. This applies if you wish to educate yourself in the occupational field within which you are already working in Denmark, or if you have become ill and can no longer perform the job for which you are trained and therefore need to undergo retraining. Below, you can read a number of examples of cases involving foreign students who are EU/EEA citizens and have applied for SU on the basis of the rules of EU law governing retention of previous worker status. The examples show our decisions, which have all been made on the basis of judgements in relation to each student’s entire case. Therefore there may be factors regarding your application that lead to a different decision, even though your situation might closely resemble the examples.

sections.heading: Example 2: SU application rejected due to an insufficient connection in terms of time and content between job and new education programme
sections.content: A Rumanian citizen trained as a social and health care assistant immediately after entering Denmark and works in this role in Denmark for six months. She then wishes to train as a nurse and applies for SU. We deem there to be a connection both in terms of time and content between her work as a social and health care assistant and her training as a nurse. Therefore she will be granted SU.

sections.heading: Example 3: SU application approved for re-training due to health reasons
sections.content: A Swedish citizen has worked as a physiotherapist for three years, but is no longer able to perform his job due to health reasons and he therefore wishes to get a new education. As his illness prevents him from using his qualifications as a physiotherapist, we deem him eligible for SU for the purposes of retraining.

sections.heading: Example 4: SU application rejected on the grounds of other job opportunities
sections.content: An Icelandic citizen is working as an unskilled person in Denmark when he contracts an illness that prevents him from continuing in his job, and he therefore wishes to get an education. We do not deem him eligible for SU for the education programme as there are other unskilled positions that he would be able to fill.

sections.heading: Example 5: Retraining due to structural conditions
sections.content: A Belgian citizen has been working as a typographer at a newspaper in Denmark. She can no longer use her qualifications as a typographer, as this type of position is being closed in connection with the introduction of IT. She now wishes to train as an architect and has applied for SU on the basis of the rules regarding retraining. We deem that she has become involuntarily unemployed due to structural conditions on the labour market for typographers and grant her SU for the education.
